intro: Calceolaria rugosa var. incisa, commonly known as the serrated slipper orchid, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, slipper-shaped flowers. The leaves are typically hairy and have a serrated edge, giving the plant its specific variety name. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. The flowers, which range in color from white to pink, bloom in late spring to early summer.
